forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. West wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 60. West wind 13 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As the evening descends upon Downtown San Francisco, a veil of mostly cloudy skies envelops the city, tempered by the steady sigh of a west wind brushing softly at 14 miles per hour. With temperatures dipping towards a cool 51 degrees, one might feel the gentle embrace of a light layer when venturing out. The likelihood of precipitation hangs low, just a whisper of 20%, suggesting that the night will maintain a dry, albeit overcast, presence. 

Looking ahead to Saturday, a promising shift in the weather will bring mostly sunny skies with a high reaching near 60. The winds will dance more vigorously, showcasing gusts that could flirt with 31 miles per hour, invigorating the air and suggesting a brisk afternoon ahead. While the morning may still hold onto some of that familiar marine layer, by midday it should offer a dazzling clarity, inviting both city dwellers and visitors alike to explore the bustling streets. Imagine taking a leisurely stroll through the vibrant neighborhoods or enjoying a quiet moment in one of the city’s lush parks—perhaps a cozy café where the warmth of a freshly brewed coffee can complement the coolness of the breeze. Dressing in layers becomes essential, allowing one to adapt as the sun breaks through and chases the cool shadows away. In these conditions, it seems fitting to indulge in the simple pleasures of life, taking in the beauty of a city that thrives under its changing skies.
